name: Hotel El Silencio del Campo

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the El Silencio del Campo. The staff was really great and made our stay extra special. We arrived early and our room wasn’t ready, the staff was really nice and offered us a variety of things to do while we waited. Since we had a long ride we opted for lunch, the food was excellent. When we were done with lunch our room was ready. I had hoped for a room with a king bed but we got two queen beds but as you cans see from the photos the room was very nice and we were very happy with our accommodations. The room was great and the grounds were simply beautiful. I loved sitting outside our cabin looking at the volcano. My husband really liked the hot springs on the grounds and we saved money since we enjoyed the hot springs on the property we didn't feel like we need to visit the larger hot springs and after talking with other travelers our decision to enjoy the hot spring at the hotel was a good one. The bartender made some really great drinks, I loved that our margaritas were made with fresh fruit juices (no mixes). I was offered a free mud facial, I am not normally a spa girl but I really enjoyed the facial and had a massage as well . It was so relaxing.
reviews.title: A perfect start to our vacation

reviews.text: The staff was amazing, I had the flu the week before we left so I didn’t get finalize all my plans the staff at the front desk took care of all our needs, arranging transportation and tours. At one point I needed to get on a computer to check on a few things at home. they gave me one of their lap tops to use.
reviews.title: I found my heart :) It's like coming home again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn’t have a car so we ate most of our meals at the property. I know some people said the food was more expensive than in town, but when we added in the cost of a taxi to and from town it made more sense to stay put for meals. Breakfast was included and we really enjoyed the dinners we had, the wait staff were very helpful and made some great suggestions. We had to leave one day before the restaurant opened for breakfast, they knew we were leaving and made sure they were available for us to have breakfast before we left.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in La Fortuna

reviews.text: This was our first stop on our trip to Costa Rica and it really set the mood for our visit. I would stay here again and would definitely recommend this property to others.
reviews.title: Fantastic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After being away from and dreaming of returning to Arenal, La Fortuna, and Silencio Del Campo for three years, we have arrived and I have found my heart again :) I love Silencio del Campo, it's owners and staff as I do my family and my own home in the U.S....
reviews.title: Amazingly good service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved Silencio del Campo and didn't want to leave. It is a wonderful place to be. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable with all the amenities you will need. The gardens are more beautiful in person than you can ever gather in pictures. The hot spring (free! for guests) is amazing. Relaxing, beautiful and with a view of Arenal. Wonderful drinks at the bar - tasty food at the on-site restaurant and service of a 5 star hotel. What a pleasure it was to stay here. I would recommend to anyone looking for rest and relaxation. Plus the hotel will help arrange all your tours of the area. If you get a chance - stay here! We hope we can go back someday.
reviews.title: Our favorite place in Costa Rica

reviews.text: My family of four included me, my husband and our two boys, ages 21 and 15. We spent three nights at Hotel El Silencio del Campo and chose it based on Trip Advisor reviews. It was the perfect choice! We had a spacious villa with two large beds. The location is ideal for sightseeing. We arrived around 1 am and when I took my cup of coffee outside the next morning at 7 am I was delighted to be greeted by the sight of the active Arenal volcano right at my doorstep. It literally took my breathe away. The grounds are just lovely -- lush, well maintained and natural. We all enjoyed the hot springs and loved having drinks and snacks at the bar after a long day. The staff and onsite owners make for a perfect vacation. Every need is attended to with a smile. All of our fabulous excursions were booked in advance by the hotel and no request was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Exceeded Our Expectations

reviews.text: The food was the biggest surprise. My son is an aspiring chef and even he couldn't find fault with any of the delicious meals we had. Everything is fresh and cooked to order using local ingredients. THE BEST guacamole we've EVER had! The restaurant staff was attentive and friendly. We loved chatting with everyone. We made the mistake of going off the grounds for dinner one night to a steakhouse at the Volcano Lodge. An absolute overpriced disaster and we kicked ourselves for not eating at the hotel. I can't say enough good things about Hotel Silencio del Campo.
reviews.title: What A Magical Place!
My wife's favorite spot in Costa Rica
reviews.text: An amazing place. Our children (14, 9, 7) loved it as well. Lot's of amazing adventures, the stuff were very helpful helping us arrange the day trips to the various activities. We loved the hot springs! Our place had an amazing view of the volcano. The food was wonderful. We did not want to leave the place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would have to disagree with my wife but this is her favorite spot in Costa Rica. It is up there. She loved the fact that it had a hot-spring; free of charge to the hotel guests. I love the lush vegetation and the layout of the cabins. It is really nice compared to the big monstrosity next door. My son love running around the compound. I like the fact it was so close to La Fortuna (by car) compared to the other resorts. I also like the free wi-fi.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Perfect Location, Very Reasonable
Fantastic Service - Great Setting
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in late November, party of four people including two seniors. The property itself is great, but the service, rooms and amenities are what make this bed and breakfast. I booked directly through them via email and received an good rate and prompt confirmations and information. There was no complete view of Arenal volcano due to cloud cover while we were there, and for the past month or so the volcano has not been spewing any lava at night. But despite that, the service, ambiance and amenities offered at Silencio del Campo made for a great stay. I would not think twice about returning here.

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - Outstanding Value
reviews.text: Pros:

-Service - owners Luis, Diego and Kattya are on-site daily, and manage things with a strong attention to detail and focus on service. From check-in to check-out, top-notch service and attention. This includes the front desk staff (Eliomar and Vanessa) who are extremely helpful, the dining room and bar staff (Shirley in particular - very diligent) and the massage staff (Maria Laura was very professional). There is just enough staff to provide good service and yet make you feel like you are in a laidback countryside setting.
reviews.title: Incredibly Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Amenities- Hot spring pool on-site, which is just as good and much more enjoyable than the larger spring resorts that accept people from outside for a fee. The complimentary volcano mud facials (one per room per stay) are also a treat, and a good way to determine whether you want to get a massage which are done by the same well-trained staff. At about $40 for a half hour, they may be expensive for Costa Rica but are a good value compared to resort spas in the USA considering the quality.
reviews.title: Good Room, Bad Food, Stay at Tabacon Instead

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Setting- Each wood cabin has unobstructed views of the volcano. The grounds are immaculately kept and landscaped, and make you feel like you really are in a quiet countryside (as the name of the hotel evokes in Spanish). The hot spring itself is nicely designed and is a very relaxing place to hang out (day but even better at night), and nearby there is a pond with large ducks and geese.
reviews.title: Perfect. All Inclusive

reviews.text: A friend and I stayed in a Villa at Silencio del Campo from Nov. 12-15. From the moment we arrived, the staff service was friendly and attentive. All our tours were booked by the hotel in advance, and any booking issues were addressed immediately upon arrival.
reviews.title: Amazing grounds, service, and rooms - Highly recommended
Great hotel, but...
reviews.text: They offer a complimentary facial in the spa, which was a nice and unexpected treat on my birthday! Breakfast is included and is quite filling and tasty. Fresh fruit every morning is a great treat. Plus there's a coffee-maker and fridge in the villa, if you find yourself needing them.

reviews.title: Will Definitely Go Back
reviews.text: The grounds were gorgeous. Fruit is placed in "trees" near the hotel restaurant during breakfast, which was an excellent bonus for this birder. There are brilliantly colored birds all around, from tanagers to orioles to hummingbirds. I spent plenty of extra time simply walking the grounds to find new wildlife. The hot springs were a nice diversion on the evening that Eco-Termales was full, but definitely try it when the waterfall is on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was great. The rooms were immaculate. This was our "splurge" during a relatively inexpensive 11-day tour of Costa Rica, and the 3 nights spent at Silencio del Campo were some of the best. We even had a great view of the volcano during our one clear day in the Arenal area. Absolutely no complaints!
reviews.title: Wonderful place, cannot wait to return.

reviews.text: For the easily amused: The towel shenanigans performed by the housekeeping staff are hilarious. Our personal favorite was the elephant. :-)
reviews.title: We’ve stayed here twice and wouldn’t hesitate to stay again

aka: Hotel El Silencio Del Campo Costa Rica/Arenal Volcano National Park
description: Hotel El Silencio del Campo besides offering amenities such as a set of swimming pools, hot springs and spa, also offers its guests 20 individual villas with a great view of the volcano, surrounded by colorful and green gardens, that gives a natural sensation to your experience.
